description: Buy the Kelty Cosmic 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cosmic 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Cosmic 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Took this on a backpacking trip to NZ and it was great!  Kept me super, super warm.  Highly recommend!
review.name: Awesome & Warm

review.reviewBody: I really like it!! I am even considering buying another one for my partner. I am 5'6" and the short size is perfect for me. Haven't tried it on any very cold nights but I was warm enough with layers in 40 and 50 degree weather.
review.name: Definitely worth the money!

review.reviewBody: I used this bag to go cowboy camping on a 40 degree night in the UP  and was so happy to have upgraded to this bag the week prior. Looking forward to taking this super compact bag on more adventures
review.name: Happy camper

review.reviewBody: Not warm enough, at all! Nearly froze below 40degrees, as we had a hard freeze at 28deg for morning low. Luckily I had a backup bag for a blanket. This 20 deg bag good for 40deg, no lower! A bit tight I the shoulders for my liking as other reviews stated?!
review.name: NOT at all warm to rated temp of 20deg

review.reviewBody: Bought it recently because I've been getting into camping/backpacking and was getting sick of rentals. I've used it a couple of times and have only had good experiences. The plastic lining next to the zipper on the inside of the bag makes zipping and unzipping the bag from the inside and outside very easy. Long bag is perfectly sized for me (6 1ish)
review.name: Reasonably Priced, warm and packs down!

review.reviewBody: Was honestly impressed by how much I loved this bag especially for the price, warm and comfy and very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great budget sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this sleeping bag for a trip to Grayson Heights in Virginia. Slept in a shelter on the AT. Woke up to 18-25° windchill, but stayed warm all through the night. Also used this to sleep in 40° weather, as well. 0 complaints.
review.name: Keeps You Warm!

review.reviewBody: This sleeping bag is sweet!! Fits me perfect
review.name: Perfect sleeping bag for 6’4”

review.reviewBody: I've had this bag for about ten years, and it's done now than it's job in all sorts of climates. Top of Mt Whitney sleeping out in the open, nice and toasty. Early February at pinnacles np around 27°f, nice and toasty. Utah, high Sierra, Tanzania, etc. Etc. Great bag.
review.name: Put it through the ringer

review.reviewBody: Purchased for use camping in CO in the fall.  Temps were in mid 30s.  Bag is super comfortable and kept me warm even when sleeping on floor of tent with just a sleeping pad underneath.  Great bag at a good price point.  Only 4 stars because it might be just a little bulky when packed for an extended stay in backcountry but I think you can manage when paired with a super light packable tent.
review.name: Great bag

name: Cosmic 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Down

description: Buy the Black Diamond Binding Buddy Multi-Tool - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Binding Buddy Multi-Tool - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Binding Buddy Multi-Tool - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: A must for any skier or snowboarder on the mountain. Easily fits in your pocket if you don't use a backpack.
review.name: Multi-tool

review.reviewBody: I've had one of these and used it for years. Then one day the little ball-bearing that holds the bits in place went sproinging across the room somewhere never to be found! I found it too annoying to use when the bits dropped out all the time, so I purchased another. I think this was a weird and unusual failure, and I find the tool otherwise well designed.
review.name: Great tool!

review.reviewBody: Did not use the tool extensively, but it seems like a good tool to Cary and use once in a while
review.name: Good first impression

review.reviewBody: Cheap design same as all the other ones. Plastic cap never stays on and end up loosing bits. I do like the little switch that changed the direction of ratchet.

The tool does the job and has useful bits. 

Unfortunately I dropped it in the snow and left some moisture in it. The whole inside, including the bits were covered in rust.
review.name: Got Rusty Fast

review.reviewBody: A bit heavy but good tools! Would be better if lighter, not going to take it on a bigger trip where weight matters
review.name: A bit heavy but good tools!

review.reviewBody: Looks like has all the right bits to work on my touring set, also seems to have high quality ratchet. We’ll see overtime.
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: A must have for your backcountry repair kit, for about 1/2 the price of what you'd pay for a Beer at the top of any Vail owned resort :) Good design, and practical for both skiers and snowboarders. Unlike other "multi-tools," if you lose one of these bits, you can easily replace them. Don't get me wrong, I love my LM "Skeletool," but two seasons ago, when I lost my #3 bit, I had to purchase a full set (10 piece) just to get the #3 !! With this tool, you can use any regular bit from your local hardware. That's a good design!
review.name: Cheap Insurance !

review.reviewBody: The tool comes in very handy, for sure, and I keep it in my pack.  But the bits fell into the snow one time and the next time I took them out they were all rusted.  Not expected for a tool that is guaranteed to get wet at some point.
A useful tool to have with you. I rarely use it, but when I need it, sometimes I really need it. It would be nice if it could be lightened up a little.
review.name: A useful tool to have

name: Binding Buddy Multi-Tool - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a lightweight Ultra with some cushion/structure since the last ultras I bought were way too heavy! The heal slips too much in these even after adjusting how I tied the laces. It seems to be the right size because I would not want it too short. Its like the whole ankle is too sloppy. I also wish there was a tad more toe protection but that is not a deal breaker. I do like the cushion and lightness. I think I'm past 30 day return since I bought them before a trip and got back and it's been a whirlwind getting kids back to school.
review.name: Almost the perfect shoe

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are so close to perfect. My main issues are durability which tends to be an issue with any Altra shoe I've tried and the heel is also too wide and it slips more than other models.
review.name: So Close to Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love Altras but have not loved the Lone Peak styling and color for a couple of seasons. I tried these, and they do not disappoint. I'll have to see how they do on long trail runs but so far for hikes they are very good.
review.name: I love these shoes

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Performs well on steep terrain, but the insoles have already fallen apart and Altra will not replace them. I've run in Altras for years and have never had this happen before.
review.name: Great shoe; poor quality

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ran my first trail run in the Mont Blancs... great product.
review.name: I would buy this product again!

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I truly love these shoes & have bought them in every color I could find. The toe box is perfect, they have just enough stability & cushion, and I have even started wearing them for road running.
review.name: I love these with my whole heart!

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great shoes but I needed to loop the laces and tie them extra tight to keep them from eating my socks, which is not normal for my favorite brand. The laces are plenty long enough for this, which is great.
review.name: Light and lovely, with heel slippage

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been running in Altras for about 4 years. I started with the Lone Peaks and have graduated to the Mont Blancs for my up coming 100 mile race. The Mont Blancs are so freaking comfortable!
review.name: Can't stop, won't stop

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was so exited about these. They look great and the grip is amazing! But the shoes are just so uncomfortable. As soon as I put them on in the parking lot before my hike they were uncomfortable. The tongue is so thin and almost too short. But I thought maybe they just needed to be walked in a bit. Less than a mile in and I stopped to do my first adjustment on the lacing. That was the first of several stops ok my only 10 mile hike. No matter how I laced or adjusted them they hurt my feet. At one point I considered taking them off and going barefoot. As soon as I got home I packaged them for return.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These seem to run small while others I have run big.
review.name: Disappointed

name: Mont Blanc Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I didn’t see any logo in the product listing. But this dress could be cute if it didn’t have a big white Backcountry logo on the back of the dress by the neck. It was an immediate return bc of that.
review.name: Ugly logo on back

review.reviewBody:
I've been wearing this dress all summer and love it! It is a super lightweight, breathable dress made of the same material as the beloved Tahoe Sun Hoody. It has kept me completely protected from the sun! I've used it as a casual dress and also love it as a swimsuit cover-up. You can throw it on over your wet swimsuit and it dries so quick. I tried both medium and large and found the fit of the medium to be better. I normally wear a large in dresses, so I'd say the fit is slightly large. If you want a more flattering fit, size down and if you want more room/the dress to be more flowy, go with your regular size. 

If you have any questions about this dress or any Backcountry products, feel free to reach out to me at amcclary@backcountry.com .
review.name: Love It!

review.reviewBody: I bought this dress bc I love the Tahoe sun hoodie for great 50+ UPF sun protection.  BGA came out with a dress in the same material and its a great throw on and go dress.  Great for wearing over your bathing suit, paddleboarding or throwing over yourself after a long sweaty trail run. This is a lightweight dress, meant to be worn more as a of coverup. I bought the black but it could also be worn as a normal dress too.
review.name: Great throw and go sun dress

review.reviewBody: Cute looking dress - love the little logo on the back - adds a little something extra. Unfortunately not quite what I expected. The material is very thin and a bit stiff / static. I guess I thought it would be thicker / nicer material. Fit was a little small. I am 5'5" and 135 (usually wear a Small and ordered a Small). Could have went up to a Medium, but this also could have been because the material didn't drape nicely / was kind of stuck to my body. It would be great if they'd make this dress in a quick dry material (that would be perfect)!  Maybe somebody will read this and do that. :)
review.name: Cute idea / not quite what I expected!

name: Tahoe Sun Dress - Women's

review.reviewBody: This blanket is fantastic and keeps me warm on cold days. Thanks so much!
review.name: Great blanket

review.reviewBody: I have had zero regrets after purchasing this blanket. It looks great on my bed and it  is super warm. I only use this blanket on top of flannel sheets, and I'm always warm at night up here in the damp Pacific Northwest.
review.name: I Love My Pendleton Blanket!
comment: Only wool blanket I have ever had was the one issues to me in the Navy, so it?s was a good blanket but a bit rough. Bought the National Parks addition and I love it.  Liked it so much I bought a second one a few weeks later.

review.reviewBody:
I have had my eye on this blanket for years. After a long wait and saving of pennies I finally purchased the Pendleton National Park Blanket Collection in Acadia. I use it everyday as a throw over my comforter because I am always cold. I constantly get compliments on my bedding and Pendleton made my dream bedroom come true. 

Be mindful this is dry-clean only. Be careful with the wool to not damage the quality.

This is as an investment, you'll have it forever.
review.name: Pendleton Everything Please

review.reviewBody: Boots are advertised as waterproof.  Unfortunately, the are not.  For the price especially, I was expecting a solid, technical boot that would function as described.  My socks are soaking wet within 30 minutes of walking around in damp, dewy morning grass.  This is not even during active rain.  No puddles.  Just damp grass when I take my dog out.  Very, as in extremely, disappointing as this is the specific reason I bought the shoes and paid a high price for them.  Otherwise, supportive fit. Roomy toe box.  Easy on/off.
review.name: Not waterproof

description: Buy the Cotopaxi Allpa Mini 20L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Allpa Mini 20L Travel Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Allpa Mini 20L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a larger size travel pack for adults I. Our upcoming family travel group but knew that my ten year old grandson would not be able to support the 28” pack. This 20” is perfect for his shorter back and still matches the style of everyone else! And the colorful pack is also fun. I’m really glad this pack comes sized for kids as well as adults.
review.name: Sized perfectly for my grandson

review.reviewBody: This is a great backpack for everyday use. Nice size for smaller people, durable and great colors.
review.name: Sky

review.reviewBody: What a wonderfully versatile backpack! I was hesitant to purchase a backpack because I'm not a big person and I was concerned I would look like a 1st grader headed off to school with any pack on my back. This one is perfect and I am delighted that it is not huge and cumbersome. It holds everything I need to carry on the train or a plane and it fits underneath the seat in front of me without worry. The quality is fantastic and I know I will get many years of use out of this bag. The colors are mellow and not masculine like bags that are all black or dark navy. Love it and highly recommend it to women and men as well!
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: This pack is a good size for someone with a small frame (5 feet tall) like me. It holds a lot and fit under the seat in an American Airline flight. (I typically fly Delta and the under-seat area seemed smaller than usual. ) I like the suitcase style. It can be a little hard to zip around the corners. My only slightly negative comment is that it’s pretty pricey. I paid more to get a single color (blue) but it still had multiple color parts which in my opinion makes it look more like a child’s pack.
review.name: Allpa mini 20L

review.reviewBody: I wanted a lightweight carryon and the mini-20 is perfect. I can a lot into it and of course, I love the colors.
review.name: Perfect Solution

review.reviewBody: I bought this for fast and light international travel and to avoid paying for carry-on fees. I have an Allpa 32, and I was hoping this bag had the same anti-tamper zipper pull protection as the 32. It would be helpful if the shoulder strap padding were a bit longer. I’m 6’ and medium build. The side pocket bottle holder is excellent. Overall a great quality Cotopaxi pack,
review.name: Light Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: Love the compartments this bag comes with and it makes quick trips much easier for me as far as organizing my clothes
review.name: cute and practical

review.reviewBody: I love that Cotopaxi is an Utah brand, I love how the company uses its sustainability and world stamp to create unique and durable items.
review.name: Love shopping local and have it be good quality!

review.reviewBody: Very nice. I am amazed at how much room there is in it. Construction of the pack details a well made product.
review.name: Alpa Mini 20L backpack

review.reviewBody: I love this bag so much! It is the perfect small travel bag and still holds sooooo much :) I pack it for everything!
review.name: Best Bag EVER

name: Allpa Mini 20L Travel Pack

review.reviewBody: It's a nice helmet, but my husband's head measured 57.5 cm so we thought we were safe going with the Medium.  Big mistake.  It was too tight for comfort.  Smith should change their measurement range for each size, based on our experience and what other reviewers have said.  I might have given it a 5 star rating, but we couldn't re-order the white helmet in L because it was sold out.  So, we picked another Smith and SIZED UP.  So, it gets a 4 just because of sizing.  Smith, are you listening???
review.name: Listen to the reviewers and SIZE UP!

review.reviewBody: Used 4 days, and so far so good.  Fit seems a little small per the head measurements.  I was technically in the range of M, but returned it and sized up to L.  Glad I did.  It now has room for my Buff hat liner too. Comfortable with nice venting, visor and straps.
review.name: Nice helmet

review.reviewBody: The side of the helmet is tight make it uncomfortable to wear
review.name: Helmet run small

review.reviewBody: Bought two different Smith ski helmets in medium using sizing chart and both of them were too small. I had to return them.
review.name: Smith ski helmets run small!

review.reviewBody: The helmet fit comfortably and follows the size guide. The padding and liner is plenty warm and comfortable. The adjustable vents are nice as long as you can remember which way open and which way is closed.
review.name: The helmet fit comfortably and

review.reviewBody: Purchased a Smith Level ski helmet in red and it has faded to pink over the last ski season. I am a male who does not want to wear a pink helmet. Contacted Smith and they will not warranty product, they don’t care that their product is defective cosmetically. Keep this in mind when purchasing Smith merchandise.
review.name: Smith Does Not Stand Behind Products

review.reviewBody:
I decided it was time to upgrade helmets this season and wanted an audio compatible one. This is my first Smith helmet and first audio compatible helmet, so I wanted to used it for several ski days, in a variety of conditions before my review. Overall, it is a great helmet, in a variety of conditions, from cold mid-winter to warmer spring skiing. The one drawback I noticed is the ear flaps let a fair amount of air by versus my old helmet, which led to cold ears during colder and windier ski days. On the other hand, the adjustable vents were great during warmer ski days to keep from overheating. I wear a 7-1/2 fitted baseball cap, and the Large size fits well either with nothing else on, or with a balaclava on the colder days.
As for the audio, now that I figured out how it works I love the ability to have background music without having ear buds in my ears that hinder my ability to hear other skiers or snow equipment. Since this was my first audio helmet, I did not know that there were removable foam pads in each ear flap that need to be removed so your music chips fit better. On my first ski day, I unzipped the access pocket and put the chips in each ear flap, but left the pads in (totally my fault but not explained in the very brief instruction manual that came with the helmet). Of course the sound was very muffled and the ear flaps were uncomfortable after a couple hours of skiing with the extra bulk. When I got home, a buddy explained the removable pads (he has a Smith helmet) to me. Once I removed them, which was very easy, sound is great at low volume, and the helmet is all-day comfortable as expected. I mention this issue for anyone new to Smith audio compatible helmets, as I was, since it makes a huge difference but is not explained in the instructions. It seems intuitive now, but as a new helmet owner I was hesitant to start pulling stuff out of the flaps if it wasn't supposed to come out.
All together I put roughly a dozen days on the new helmet this season, and would definitely purchase it again for its comfort and high quality safety features.
review.name: Great Helmet and Love the Audio Compatibility

review.reviewBody:
bad: i've worn a size L my entire life in smith. for some reason this helmet runs super small and gives me a massive headache. so SIZE UP. it's also a good bit heavier feeling than my previous variance.

the great: the helmet is super tech heavy. the venting is great, and the thing just *feels* so much more solid and secure than any helmet i've ever worn. i hope to never test it out in an accident, but if i do, i feel good about how it will treat me.
review.name: runs small and a bit heavy but nice tech

review.reviewBody:
Love this helmet- fits very comfortably and my head is neither too hot nor too cold and I've skied in 0F, icy rain, and blizzard conditions. 
My friend crashed into me while riding and I took a very hard hit to the head - helmet did it's job and I walked away just fine. I could feel and hear the back of the helmet taking the impact exactly how it's supposed to. 
I feel extremely safe wearing this helmet.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: Got the Level helmet as a gift an it’s comfortable and fits great but the VaporFit Snow™ dial adjustment system occasionally loosens all by itself. Not sure if it’s something I’m doing or if it’s a defect.
review.name: Jury is out - possible defect

name: Level Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I measured as medium for the upper measurement for the knee and elbow pads and as large for the lower measurement for each. I went with the large and am glad I did. I wear these mainly for lift-served downhill riding. If I were to use them for normal rides, I'd pull them down for the climbs and put them in place for extended downhill sections. They saved me the first time out. Two times down one run on some steep sharp corners my bike slid out and I ended up sliding on my knees and elbows. No abrasions, not even a bruise. Without the pads, I'm sure I would have come away with bad, bleeding abrasions.
review.name: Go with largest size measurement

review.reviewBody: Bought the Disc 34 RS as a replacement for the stock shimano L03A pads that came with my Ultegra RS8070 hydraulic calipers.  Chose these simply due to no availability of the stock pads.  I bedded-in the pads according to instructions, and everything works fine with about 100 miles on them.  Can't really tell much difference between these and the stock pads, a good thing I guess.  Braking is quick, smooth, and silent.  I had some initial rubbing that turned about to be rotor warping, a slightly sticky caliper piston, and slightly misaligned caliper (root causes of most problems from my experience).  After fixing those, no complaints.
review.name: Good replacement for stock shimano pads

name: Disc RS Brake Pads

review.reviewBody: Great fit. I'm 5'7" and always hated the pile of unused pant around my ankle with standard 32" inseam. The 30" on these fits me way better!

review.reviewBody: I ordered the freedom bibs knowing I'd be using them for both skiing and riding my motorcycle. Could have ordered a size smaller but wanted enough room to wear sweats or jeans under. Exactly what I need. They're perfect!
review.name: Perfect for snow and riding!

review.reviewBody: These bibs are great for our outdoor horse day. We used long underwear before...these are so much easier!
review.name: Nice bibs for outdoor activities

review.reviewBody: Pretty thin layer. Definitely good for early season or blue birds. Simple design. Would recommend!
review.name: Not for powder

review.reviewBody: These seem more like a shell. Am i missing something? Are they going to be warm at all?
review.name: Are they supposed to be so thin?

review.reviewBody: If they could add a little more stretch in this guy, it would be perfect. While the fit is lovely, I feel like I should have bought a size up for movement. Overall, a very comfortable pair of bibs that should keep me dry all winter long.
review.name: Nice Bibs, Minus One Thing

review.reviewBody: I plan on using these bibs for snowboarding this winter. The lightweight and waterproof fabric will be so convenient compared to my heavy bibs I used to wear.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again

review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Haven't used them yet but they seem great quality!

review.reviewBody:
I bought these to give me a more aggressive shoe for gym climbing/training, since I climb outside in high tops (Aspect Pros for hard climbs; Evolv Generals for long cruiser days). 

Bought an 8.5- same as my Aspect and Aspect Pro shoes. The fit is definitely more tight and aggressive, but I don’t notice any discomfort when I have them on while climbing. They hurt while walking (what aggressive shoes don’t, though?), and if I climbed a hard sport multi, I would definitely want them off at belays.

The rubber is plenty sticky, and has just the right balance of sensitivity and support. 

Only knock is that I wish the forefoot strap was a bit longer, but with the design and added rubber for toe hooking, it’s just not doable.
review.name: Comfort and good performance

review.reviewBody: I have a wide foot and usually buy US10 or US9.5 street shoes. When buying BD Momentum shoes I go with US11.5 for a very tight fit, but after some time they stretch enough to allow me to wear on a day long multi-pitch climb. I bought Method Climbing Shoes in US12 size after trying them in a shoe demo, however they never stretched enough to be comfortable for a longer periods of time. Other than the size misadventures, those are great shoes and I will get US 12.5
review.name: Good shoe of inconsistent size

review.reviewBody: It takes about 2 weeks to break the shoes in and then you get the full experience. After the 2 week small foot holds on an incline feel like second nature.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: The shoes feel fine, but they are constructed very poorly. After only a few months of moderate use the velcro doesnt stay shut, one of velcro straps ripped slightly, and the rubber is coming apart in several places.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody:
I know that most people like there toes curled but my 3rd, 4th and 5th toes are a little bit longer and I don't want to destroy my toes if it is not necessary, I am a Roman profile , I purchased UK 11, I am street shoe size 11 us, and i think that if i would have purchased maybe a UK11.5 could fit better with my feet/toe profile or even a 12UK.
The heel is molded like if they took my 3d printed heel it is great, the shoe is really stiff great for small holds but could present a little bit of challenge whit smearing not much of an issue anyways.
So the most important thing for people unless you love to crush your feet in my case as I stated i am 11 US and purchased 12 US but i think that a 13 US would feet just great snug but without pain or hot spot on my 3rd or 2nd toe, I noticed that it is ok to feel discomfort but by no means any kind of pain for my taste I need to be comfortable to climb at my max effort and not restrain because of unnecessary pain (note: I WOULD GO FROM MY STREET SHOE SIZE 11 ALL THE WAY UP TO 12.5 OR 13 BECAUSE OF MY ROMAN PROFILE, IF YOU DONT HAVE A ROMAN OR GREEK PROFILE I WOULD THINK THAT THEY JUST FIT GREAT ONLY 1 PLUS SIZE FROM YOUR STREET SHOE SIZE) basically the 11 US is a 10 US) My foot measures 28mm and the shoe as US11 is 27mm 
I would love this shoe to have only one strap instead of 2 I found the second one to be useless and with the first one doesn't matter how you fit it it will always look baggy in my feet.
review.name: Great Shoe but could be better!

review.reviewBody: I am wearing the shoes around the house, they are breaking in. I got a half size larger than my shoe size! Can’t wait to try them at the climbing gym.
review.name: I am wearing the shoes

review.reviewBody: I really like a lot about these, but the fit was bizarre. Maybe not for narrow feet? With the straps on pretty snug, I could literally pull them off my feet. In order to get them tight enough so I couldn’t pull them off, I had to strap them down so tight the buckle left imprints in my skin and was painful. I returned them. Bummed tho, they seemed really nice- rubber seemed sticky and construction seemed high quality.
review.name: Bizarre fit

review.reviewBody: Love the heel fit. Super comfortable. Sizing varies among BD footwear but now I have a method to my madness.
review.name: Method

review.reviewBody: Bought these after my Momentum's were failing me on overhung route. These are perfect for me, not too aggressive, but enough to hook holds with my toe. Still moderate enough to climb slab or vertical, and you can smear just fine with them. The heel is great too, the heel hooks are a little more solid with these. Ordered same size as my Momentum's and they're a tad snug on one foot. I think they will stretch out fine.
review.name: Good shoe for overhangs or Slab

review.reviewBody: I got these shoes since my old ones have never really been comfortable. I bought a half size bigger than my street shoes and wore them around the house before taking them climbing. Once I finally took them to the gym I was able to wear them for 30 minutes comfortably. Great shoes with awesome grip and I’m happy to have something comfortable.
review.name: Very comfortable

name: Method Climbing Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Tricot Peak Tech Hoodie - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Initially, I was impressed with the hoodie's uncommon color (Grapesde/Hortensia), two pockets with three zippers, and thumb holes, plus a face mask. However, the size M was enormous and clearly designed for taller people, rendering the thumb holes useless. The face mask is also poorly designed, with an unflattering grey-greenish hue and uncomfortable neck fit when not in use. 
Despite loving the pockets and color, I'm disappointed and wouldn't recommend it.
review.name: Runs LARGE + Strange face covering idea

review.reviewBody: We went for a 2-week expeditionary cruise to Greenland and Iceland…from Phoenix, Arizona in August. Needless to say, we didn’t have a lot of cold weather clothes and I had no idea what to expect or prepare for. This hoodie turned out to be the best purchase of all! I told multiple people on the ship about it. The built-in gator was perfect for Zodiac rides among the icebergs, and as a layering piece it defended extremely well against the wind and cold (only a slight bit of rain, so not sure about wetness). I am so happy that I made this purchase!
review.name: Best piece of clothing I had for Arctic!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for spring skiing - I ilked the oversized style, all the zip pockets, and the built-in mask. It's insanely comfortable. I am 5'3" and 185lbs and I ordered an XL which fits comfortably over my bib ski pants.
review.name: New go-to

review.reviewBody: Wore this snowboarding and it kept me warm (only wore a base layer with a long sleeve over) all day. The built in face mask was also nice during powder days, protected my face and kept snow from falling down my neck.
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.reviewBody: I wear this to go the gym.  I like the fabric and the multifunctional pockets I can stash small pieces.  I don't have to carry a bag or anything.  The fabric washes well and I like the length.  I am usually a M but I decided to go with a Small for a trimmer fit and I like the fit.  It does run slightly baggy in the middle and I am just very narrow there so decided to go small and I am glad I did.  I might go for another color.
review.name: Gym Hoodie

review.reviewBody: I love my gear that I purchased, but I am super bummed there are not extended sizes. Outdoors should be cute and functional for everyone.
review.name: Love it, but bummed no ext sizes!

review.reviewBody: Runs a bit big but I'm keeping it because I'll be able to layer underneath. I like the built in face cover. Will be perfect for late fall soccer sidelines :)
review.name: Runs big

name: Tricot Peak Tech Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody: I tried these on and then returned them.  5'9", 155 lbs.  Cycling is my primary exercise, with emphasis on long rides.  Thighs were a little tight but primary fit issue was strange cut at the waist with the front dropping to a lower level than any pants I have ever worn.  Very strange.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: I have two pairs.  Wear mostly for work. Good selection of sizes to choose from. Very comfortable and look good.
review.name: Nice Pants

review.reviewBody: Great for any occasion and absolutely everything pant.
review.name: The best all around pant.

review.reviewBody: I really love the look and comfort of these pants but I can see they’re already wearing out. I have a very short bike commute ( about 10 minutes) and after just a couple rides, I can see these pants thinning in the seat. I’ve never had pants show signs of wear so fast. Bummer.
review.name: Great looking pants— not too tough

review.reviewBody: Good pant, good color.. stretchy. Great for moving around and not feeling restricted.
review.name: Stretchy

review.reviewBody: I like the lightweight feel of these. Nice fabric weight for the summer, but still keeping me warm this winter. Bought the Dark Mud and Denim colors, both in size 30x34. Like both the colors, Dark Mud goes well with a couple blue shirts I have. I'm 6'1", 160 and the fit good. Not tool slim fit and the cotton, polyester, spandex mix makes them move with you.
review.name: Favorite jeans so far

review.reviewBody: These pants are awesome!! HOWEVER they are not slim fit so be aware. The fit and style is more like loose fit chinos. Still , a great pair of pants from PrAna
review.name: Quality Pants

review.reviewBody: These fit very good, but the zipper is only about 2 1/2" long. I'm still not sure if these were 2nd's as I've never had jeans with this problem. You literally have to pull your pants down to pee.
review.name: SHORT ZIPPER

review.reviewBody:
Soft lightweight yet somehow durable. I have 8 pairs of these in different colors. 

I would note that only the denim color is actually denim. Others are khakis. 

I have a pair that look like black denim but they are mostly acrylic. They are much thicker than the rest

They fit like tailored straight leg although beware that Prana sizing can be very inconsistent. I?ve returned stuff and reordered in the exact same model/size/color and had a different fit.
review.name: Favorite jeans/pants

review.reviewBody:
I hate jeans.  Pretty much haven't touched em since 2008 :-P.  But I love these jeans.  Extremely comfortable and flexible, I can kick and lunge and sit down without adjusting my waistband.

I'm tall and lanky and the fit is practically tailored.  Very comfy.
review.name: Like butta

review.reviewBody: This is a great little dip kit. it is small but you can stuff a lot into it. It hangs nicely and if you don't pack it too much you can workout of it. the straps keep it open at just the right angle. The zippers are a pain, stiff and hard to get all the way closed. I purchased extra zipper pulls and they make all the difference. I like the shape and size.
review.name: This is a great little dip kit

review.reviewBody: The travel canister matches perfectly with my north face duffel bag now my toiletries are nicely organized and ready for any adventure I will have on vacation or just a weekend get away! I'm very excited!
review.name: Great matching addition to my duffle bag !

review.reviewBody: It is really quality and the small fits a lot. Only gripe is that it's slightly annoying to open and close but it is definitely quality.
review.name: Great Toiletry Bag

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect size for all the necessary toiletries. It even has a nice little mirror on the inside. It could also be used as a pencil case if you'd want that.
review.name: Great mini bag!

review.reviewBody: Durable and great color. I wish they had it in red. It would have been great with my red NF duffel bag.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: Great Size can take anywhere and has multi uses. Excellent for traveling, the gym, or storing school supplies, a mini first aid kit, or electronical devices that attach to your laptop. I bought 4 all together. 2 large canisters and 2 small for traveling and the gym. This is a practical item and I would buy again
review.name: Happy Customer

review.reviewBody: Solid bag! It was a little smaller than I anticipated as I use the canister as a travel toiletry bag, but the overall design and build of the bag is A+. I would certainly buy another one in the future.
review.name: Solid bag

review.reviewBody: Great travel kit for my teenage son who does a lot of team travel for sports. Fits his facial products along with shampoo/conditioner, toothbrush...etc!
review.name: Great for teens who travel

review.reviewBody: Perfect size - fits everything I need for a short trip. Easy to use and seems pretty sturdy so far
review.name: Highly recommended small toiletry travel bag

review.reviewBody: Awesome product to store tnf accessories
review.name: I would buy this product again and again!

hasVariant.name: Resolve 15L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Resolve 15L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Resolve 15L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Resolve 15L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this pack to replace my super worn out REI flash pack and wow. It is *nice* - way more of an upgrade than I was expecting. Took it out for it's maiden voyage this weekend on a long day hike and was impressed by how comfortable and secure the pack felt even when carrying 3+ liters of water and all the other various day hike items (no hip belt needed!). Comfort aside, all the details of this pack are really well thought out. I'm loving the compression straps that can be moved around to fit different needs and the way the strap ends can be tucked behind the back panel. The fact that the whole pack is recyclable is extra icing on the cake (although I can't imagine needing to do that anytime soon since this bag feels bomb proof). I think my only wish would be for chest strap pockets that would fit a large phone but the side pockets work just fine for this. Overall, really glad I bought this pack and can't wait to take it out more!
review.name: Expectations exceeded

review.reviewBody: This pack is the only thing I need. I use it day hiking, traveling and commuting to work. It carries well, has lots of adjustability and looks great. It is well constructed and its features are many. I love being able to carry different types of hydration bottles an/or a bladder . The pack is well made and I’m sure will serve me well for years to come. Would highly recommend!
review.name: New Go To

review.reviewBody: The pack is light weight, functional, and carries everything I need for a day hike. The pack breathes due to the design, and you barely notice it’s there. The color is great and the included straps have come in handy.
review.name: Best pack I own!

review.reviewBody: I haven't hiked with the pack yet but been looking at all the features of the pack and have been super impressed. I think the material are a good balance between light weight and durable fabrics. It has great design features including the lashing points that will be perfect for trekking poles or an extra jacket. I'm looking forward to getting out on the trail with this pack.
review.name: Great Versatile Pack Design

review.reviewBody:
Sometimes I just want a small pack for food, water, a lightweight layer, and any other small items for a hike. This pack is really sweet for that - well-designed with a great balance of features and simplicity. And the materials seem really durable - I expect that I will use it for a long long time. I'm replacing another small pack that I've had for years and this pack is more comfortable and less flimsy.
A note on the color. The Granite Blue looks more like a lilac (with light pink highlights) to me.
review.name: Super design and construction

review.reviewBody:
I bought the resolve 15L a few weeks ago. I wanted something I can use for day hikes, theme parks, traveling, personal, etc. So far it hasn't disappointed. The size is perfect. The material feels durable, it's comfortable, it has two water bottle holders. If I put something heavy, I have the hip belt to provide extra support and relieve weight on my back. 
Don't think about it. Buy it!
review.name: Comfortable and Great Quality

review.reviewBody: I have been using this as both a hiking back and daily bike commuting backpack. I have been very impressed by the comfort of the straps; they cup my shoulders perfectly and can carry heavy weight without digging into my chest at all. The materials and craftsmanship is exactly as I would expect from Nemo! Bombproof construction!
review.name: Bomb proof and comfortable

review.reviewBody:
This pack is lightweight and really comfortable. I've struggled finding packs that are comfortable on my shoulders and I think I have found that in this bag. The straps don't dig in and are really cushioned, I like the adjustable chest strap and the back panel cushioning is comfortable as well. The materials are great, I got caught in the rain my first time using the water repellant exterior worked perfectly, all my stuff (including my expensive camera) were completely dry. Also like the outer clip loops! I would 100% buy this bag if they made a 50L for backpacking.

My only critique is that I wish there was a smaller exterior pocket to store small things like nutrition bars/snacks. I used the small interior pocket for this but wish there was one on the front in addition to the secret key pocket.
review.name: Love this pack

review.reviewBody: I have been using this pack for some time now and am impressed by the durability, pocket positioning, and storage capacity. Although I purchased the 15L it feels very spacious.
review.name: Lightweight, Durable and Comfortable

name: Resolve 15L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago needing a durable replacement for an outdated suitcase. I simple have been enjoying my past two trips with this piece of luggage with its many compartments and smart design. I rather enjoy how it stands apart from the typical bag you see at an airport making it an easy spot at the carousel.
review.name: Excellent versatile stylish suitcase

review.reviewBody:
I bought this rolling duffle to replace my medium sized “Eddie Bauer Expedition” rolling duffle which I loved but kept wearing through on the corners ( 4 different bags). 
The Thule is more expensive but heavier nylon, still with two compartments, able to be cinched down to save space, and good quality wheels. 
BTW we travel a lot for extended periods and are very hard on luggage. This Thule stood up well with several weeks in Tx and then a month in Morocco.
review.name: Great travel bag

review.reviewBody: This bag is great because it is large enough to fit a lot inside, yet sleek and light enough to still maneuver easily. The different compartments make it easy to keep your things organized.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: Love this bag. The bigger wheels do make a difference. Sounds silly but they do. If you pack smart this size is perfect for weeks on the road. I travel for work and hope this bag can handle the friendly skies.
review.name: Very Nice!

review.reviewBody: I love this luggage. Super roomy and it looks great.
review.name: Another great product from Thule

name: Subterra 28in Rolling Gear Bag

hasVariant.name: Journey PerfectFIT Signature 26L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Journey PerfectFIT Signature 26L Backpack online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
After two good hikes with fairly steep climbs/descents, I can say I am very happy with the comfort level of this backpack.  My son nods off for naps in it too, and loves the view.  The sunshade is so easy to use and the storage space inside the zippered pockets is great.  The waist band pockets have plenty of space, which I appreciate as well.  I am a petite woman and the fit was easy to achieve.  
The only downside is that there are no water bottle sleeves on this pack.  I had hoped for an external pocket perhaps, but there isn't an internal one either, so a bottle just has to sit loose in the pockets.  Very happy though with this and with how happy my son is in it while hiking.
review.name: Very comfortable for me + my son

name: Journey PerfectFIT Signature 26L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought this pair of boots a month ago, and I’m very happy! They are warm, and comfortable! You do need a little time to brake them in, but they are worth it!  The fit is spot on for me, the description on line is correct. Height, weight.
review.name: Great boot!

review.reviewBody:
Felt ok at first, now seem a tad short. Ordered 1/2 size up to accommodate wool ski socks. 
Just used snowshoeing. Feet were wet. Water resistant and supposed impermeable not good enough. 
I will only go with Danner going forward
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
These are the boots I’ve been looking for all my life! Warm, supportive without biting into my feet or thick ankles, comfortable right out of the box, and great traction. I need arch support for my flat feet, and these give it. I wear 7.5 in running shoes, ordered 8 regular and it’s a great fit. I really like all the lacing options too, in case I need to tighten or loosen different places on the ankle or foot. 

These do dip down in the back, which makes it easier to get on and more comfortable in the ankle. But the lower back lets snow in, if I’m in deep snow. I’ll accommodate with gaiters as needed, no problem.
review.name: Great support and traction

review.reviewBody:
This is my second time purchasing the Bridger 7in Insulated B-Dry Boot - Women's.
These boots saved my feet because I have Plantar Fasciitis.
I even wear them in the summer because I haven't found any other boots or shoes that would support my arch without causing me pain.
Some reviews commented that they weren't as warm, I just inserted the Little Hotties toe warmers on really cold days. I live in Minnesota, and we have some seriously cold weather and the inserts worked great with these boots.
Someone else complained about the boots not being waterproof, I find that most waterproof boots need to be sprayed with new waterproof spray after the boots have been worn for a while. I use Shoeboy's Nano Protect spray, and my boots are now fully waterproof again.
Also, I wear size 7 in my tennis shoes, and I ordered an 8 in these boots, and they fit perfect.
review.name: Insole has great arch support

review.reviewBody: These boots fit and look great, but your feet will freeze.  Back to my old Sorels - what a difference!  Unfortunately, I ordered them before winter and now I can't return them.  Do not buy,
review.name: not warm

review.reviewBody: I love these boots.  We've had ice on top of snow, and more snow and more snow in the Chicago area.  I've used cleats with and without and they have worked great for me!  They are warm and keep my feet dry and toasty.  Love them.
review.name: Oboz Bridger

review.reviewBody: I've worn them two times in the snow and they leak. Needless to say I'm really disappointed because my other pair of Oboz was so great. Do not buy.
review.name: Not waterproof
comment: I had this same problem and I bought mine around the same time. Faulty batch?

name: Bridger 7in Insulated B-Dry Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Men's
review.reviewBody: This product is almost perfect, only problem I have with it is that its just a little tight with the waste band. I have purchased other products like this from smartwool and other companies like it in the same size and fits great. After a while the slight discomfort will go away but its still an annoying for the first 30 mins of putting on. Does a great job of keeping you warm while staying breathable to help wick moisture away. Wore these every day I was doing snow removal.
review.name: Warm and almost perfect

review.itemreviewed: Intraknit Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for the husband, and he reports great things about comfort and warmth, but the fabric is fragile (yet fairly thick, oddly enough). He found several snags after just one wear and wash (and nothing in the laundry load could be blamed). A couple of the snags were significant.  Future washings will be done in a mesh zipper bag.
review.name: Warm but snaggy

review.itemreviewed: Skyliner LWR Premium Grain Buffalo Ski Glove + Pull-Strap
review.reviewBody: Haven?°t had these gloves for three weeks and they are already pretty much unusable. I?m a chairlift operator four to five days a week so when I’m not using my gloves to bump chairs, I use them to board with? Ironically, they held up just fine for my job but after just ONE session of using them to get up the rope at the terrain park, both gloves developed some pretty big tears on the inside of the middle and index fingers. They weren?t on the seams either; the rope literally chewed holes right through the leather itself in a matter of hours. If you use the rope at the slope, these gloves are a nope.
review.name: Disappointingly Poor Quality

review.itemreviewed: Skyliner LWR Premium Grain Buffalo Ski Glove + Pull-Strap
review.reviewBody: The gloves are constructed using high caliber materials with a well thought out design. However, the fingers had an extra ° inch of room, rendering them about as useful as mittens. These gloves were purchased for my wife, unfortunately we ended up returning them.
review.name: Well made, affordable high quality

review.reviewBody:
I ordered this thinking it was much larger than it was, but I was pleasantly surprised at how much this little tyke can pack inside it. My primary reason for upgrading was because my previous briefcase could fit my 15" laptop and that was about it. This little thing can fit my laptop, my reMarkable tablet, my pens, my keys, my pillow, my bed, my bedroom, my house and even 2 extra stalls for my cars. 

Really though, if you're looking for something compact but can hold a lot, these guys did it right. I had spent weeks scouring the web for something that fit what I was looking for and it's right here in this little gem.
review.name: Skeptical at first, but worth it

review.reviewBody: I wasn’t a fan at first, but once I pared them with an outfit and felt the comfort of the shoe, I changed my mind.  The shoes are great
review.name: Great look

review.reviewBody: True to size. The toe box is very wide and I appreciate that it allows room for thick socks/swelling. Waterproof although I don't know if I would purposefully splash in puddles. I use them for light hiking and a daily driver in a rainy city (soccer games, etc) and I love that their height also means your pants stay away from puddles too.
review.name: Comfortable, waterproof, cool

review.reviewBody: Wore to work to see how comfortable it is before taking it out on terrain. Good thing I did because my feet hurt, and felt tired after 4 hours. Wouldn’t want to be on a hiking trail feeling that uncomfortable. Not the best purchase I made this year.
review.name: Not the one
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: I like these sneakers because they are water proof/resistent and a bit warmer than my running sneakers. They do really well on slippery surfaces. They are comfortable but I was hoping for more cushion to be able to go for miles. The shoe is stiff but it’s not an issue for me. They look good too.
review.name: Winter sneaker?

review.reviewBody:
Wore these on a recent trip to China that involved about 10 miles of walking everyday in below freezing weather. I was quite pleased that my feet stayed toasty and dry. These shoes performed as well as any running shoe I’ve ever worn as far as comfort. 

I am normally wear a size 7.5. With Salomon’s I always wear a sz 7. This one is no different.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody:
These were a replacement for another style as they were leaking. My left foot soaking wet every time I wear them in the wet. 
Never buying another pair of Salomon’s again
Don’t think the quality of make is up to standard anymore, made all over the world. Very poor
review.name: Replacement pair
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to write to us.

Knowing what consumers think of our products allows us to determine what works or could be improved in our designs.

We would like to inform you that your comments will be forwarded to our product manager.

If you have any comments to add or questions regarding our other products, please do not hesitate to contact us. We will be very happy to discuss your experience with you or provide further information.

review.reviewBody: I have these and they are amazing however once the stitching is dirty it’s hard to get clean, with they did an all black version, would be more practical.
review.name: More colors!!

review.reviewBody: I bought these a few months ago and wore them hiking in Colorado. The size was perfect and they were so well cushioned and comfy.  They were my 2nd pair of Salomons and I would purchase them again.
review.name: Super comfy and supportive

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had these for a couple of months now, and wanted to test them properly before reviewing them.
They have been very comfortable from day one, with no breaking in required. They look more like trainers on steroids than hiking shoes, but they give great support. I’m a size UK 7.5, and I purchased a UK 8. This is a good fit with a pair of padded sports socks. 
The sole design makes them strangely easy to walk in and the back/heel area is well shaped - my heel doesn’t move at all. The insole is very supportive and so far they are pretty waterproof. Overall I’m really pleased with them.
There are a couple of slight negatives - They are a narrow fit compared to other Salomons I have (I thought they might loosen up, but they haven’t yet) and they need to have a fully dark version. I have the darker carbon/blue Pearl/flint colour but the light bit totally lost the first battle with a muddy puddle! 
If you don’t have wide feet and you aren’t precious about keeping the light bits pristine I’d definitely recommend them. I would buy them again. Salomon please make them in a darker colour way though!
review.name: Very comfortable from day one.

review.reviewBody: The pants are too long and baggy in a weird, unflattering way. The material seems comfy and resistant to abrasion, though. BD needs to work on the fit of these pants before they'll be wear-worthy for me.
review.name: too long & baggy in a bad way

review.reviewBody: Durable, comfortable, good stretch. I think these are my new favorite outdoor climbing pants.
review.name: Love these pants

review.reviewBody: These are huge, I am sure they are supposed to be baggy, but they aren't in a good way. I returned them.
review.name: Baggy

review.reviewBody: A little tight at first but has quickly become a go to
review.name: A little tight at first

review.reviewBody: Got XS size, fits very well. I'm 5ft4in, floor to belly button 3ft3in. The pants sits right below my belly button and reaches my akles. Fabric feels soft and seems resistant, enough room around the leg and hips to allow full leg movement. I recommend it!
review.name: excelent pants!

review.reviewBody: Hyper confo! Assez habillé pour le social, sans être un pyjama.
review.name: Super confortable

review.reviewBody: While I do climb, I actually bought these pants with wildlife/nature photography in mind. I was looking for a cotton, relaxed-fit pant with proper pockets for use in the desert during spring when temps are generally mild (lows in the 40s, highs in the 70s). I wanted a pant that'd be suitable for hiking, kneeling, and crouching--all while protecting my skin and holding their own against rocks, vegetation, etc. I thought pants designed for climbing would be perfect in this regard, and while they do indeed fit the bill, they're just not going to last over multiple seasons. Consistent with other negative reviews I read, my pants are already showing signs of wear (bought Feb 2024), and I don't even climb in them! There are some pulled threads/tufts, the stitching has come undone on my back pocket, and the fabric looks generally distressed. I can't imagine how these pants would hold up as a climbing pant, and I'd be truly livid if I bought them at full price ($95). That said, I bought mine for 30-something dollars on sale, and at that price point, they're solid. Lastly, for anyone who's interested in buying these pants specifically for climbing, do note that they have plenty of movement but are still generally more restrictive than other options out there.
review.name: Good pants, but only for the right price

review.reviewBody: I like these pants, but the design in the last few years to make the butt extra roomy does not work for me. Even an XS is loose. I wish they’d make these pants more fitted in the rear like they did several years ago. Those were perfect!
review.name: I like these pants, but

review.reviewBody: Do you enjoy going into a climbing excursion feeling like the love child of an African Rhino and Alex Honnold? Then these are the pants for you! Bought them about a month ago for outdoor (and indoor) climbing.  Very impressed with how they have held up against friction/abuse from my harness, the walls, and rock faces! Only downside is the swamp-effect and chafing in warmer temps/humidity - unless of course you enjoy a raw chicken look at your waist and thighs...sure had me wishing for a little more ventilation (even in the Spring). Thankfully, the elastic bottoms allowed for some creative rolling or moonshining wouldn't have been the only thing going down in the KY heat! If you are looking for a great pair of pants overall (when used in early mornings and cooler temps*), Add to Cart.
review.name: Durability worth the Black Diamond label

review.reviewBody: Great pants for climbing, just it runs a little bit big
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: This was my first pair of Birkenstocks and I wish that I had purchased a pair years ago. Buy a pair, you won't regret it. As a  side note, the gearheads here at BC (Fischer) worked with me to find the right size. Great CS!

review.itemreviewed: Arizona Soft Footbed Leather Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Runs really large, got a 44 and ended up getting a 42. I went to a retail shop that had a lot of the normal birks to find out what size I really was (between a 41/42.) I wear adidas and nike 11's and online resources showed me that 11's would fit a 44. When I tried the the 44's on, I ended up having an extra inch and 1/2 of space at the top with my heel all the way back. 

However, It is a great shoe, and for me (high arch) has pretty good arch support! Compared to the normal beds the in-person retail place had, the soft beds are completely worth it!

description: Buy the MSR AutoFlow Gravity Filter Replacement Cartridge online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: AutoFlow Gravity Filter Replacement Cartridge
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR AutoFlow Gravity Filter Replacement Cartridge online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I happily discovered that Backcountry was stocking the replacement MSR filter for the Autoflow Gravity system.  These have been out of stock at MSR and not even offered by another nationwide outdoor products retail cooperative, though they sell the system (how does that make sense?!).  The new filter was due in my system and speeded up water filtration noticeably.
review.name: Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: First two uses it was VERY slow. Ever since then it’s been really great
review.name: First two uses it was

review.reviewBody: I have owned this filter for 4 seasons and use it at least 25-30 days per year. It has held up great. I am buying a replacement filter because we had to backflush for every use on the last trip where we used a lot of lake water. Helpful tip to others is that if you want a lightweight way to backflush in the field you can just bring a Lifewater bottle of water with the nozzle top. This fits perfectly on the back end of the filter and allows you to forcefully clear the filter in the field with already filtered water. The issue is that you have to make sure you always have some filtered water before you do that!
review.name: Heavy Duty and Durable

review.reviewBody:
The filter is bussin'.
Even wondered if it was filtering, the flow was incredible.
review.name: The filter is bussin'. Even

review.reviewBody: I reviewed this product in the past and gave it 4 stars; so fast, but questioned it's longevity...can now say, these babies ROCK. Best system I've used in over 20 years of providing safe water to large groups of clients. Recommend the Autoflow 100%.
review.name: Best Expedition Filter EVER

review.reviewBody: I have used these filters in my base camp for a number of years now. They work incredibly well and are easily cleaned by back flushing. Depending on the water you are filtering they last a decent amount of time. I am out a lot and usually go through 2 cartridges per season. They are quite rugged but you must not let them freeze. Really good filter.
review.name: Great filter in camp

review.reviewBody: I love this filter, the gravity water system is worth the weight. It takes no effort except finding a place to have the bag. It's light weight and fast. If you back flush the cartridge periodically it stays useful even in the dirtiest water conditions.
review.name: Definitely Great

review.reviewBody: Love my MSR water filters. Easy and never fail. Never going back to pump filters.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I offer guided multi day river rafting trips here in Alaska, for groups of up to 12 people. We've tried a variety of water filtration systems over a 20 year period of time...maybe all of them? This little puppy can really flow some water. The large capacity water input bag is a bonus, for when we are hydrating a large group. The cartridges retained their flow rate quite well over the weeks of heavy use, but we have only used this system for one summer and the rivers were super clear and clean due to dry, warm weather conditions. So far, I find them to be the best option available for gravity fed expedition use. I would give this water filtration system five stars+, if it was provided with a field back-flushing kit. At about a hundred gallons, the syatem began to slow down and the only option was to swap in a new cartridge.
review.name: Fast and reliable water filtration

review.reviewBody: Much faster and easier than hand pump filters, but you must back flush every 8-10 liters even if the water appears clear. I didn't pay much attention to this at first because the water I was filtering was from a tap and appeared to be clear, but it contained tanin and began slowing down. MSR (Cascade designs) customer service flushed the filter for me for a reasonable cost and now it works fine. Great customer service and turnaround.
review.name: Fast and easy filtering

name: AutoFlow Gravity Filter Replacement Cartridge

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am so glad we have this for running around in the cold. We live in the snow belt. She has a heavier snow suit but this is great for quick store runs
review.name: Super Cute, well made

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We loved this and can't wait to take our baby camping!
review.name: So cute

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfy, perfect for winter, and too cute!!!!!!!!
review.name: Buy it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was 10x more functional than we imagined. It's so easy to put on and take off. Anytime we plan on taking our little one to a place they'll be active or where it's warmer we dress him up in something super light and put this "Sherpa Bunting" on top. We love it! I don't see the colorway we purchased available anymore. Columbia is really obnoxious with all the weird colors they pick.
review.name: Awesome alternative to a coat for your littles.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Soft and comfortable for baby. Light weight but super warm.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought for my 2.5 month Grandson. He’s a big boy so I ordered the 3/6 months which was not too big for him. Enough Room for layering clothing and hood for a beanie. 
We’re in northern Utah. It’s perfect for babies to get to and from vehicle to destination. Fits great in car seats,. It’s midweight, not bulky but still warm and cozy. The quality is excellent ,made with soft Sherpa. I’m going to order another one for next winter!
review.name: My cute little Fox

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you want your baby to be the cutest kid at the playground I 1000% recommend this onsie! It keeps them so warm and cozy and helps us to be able to enjoy the outdoors longer in these colder months. 10/10 recommend!
review.name: Just buy it!

review.reviewBody: Looks great 👍🏻 fit perfect to my baby, my baby can wear like next costume
review.name: Little bear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The color matches the picture perfectly, and the material very soft. Super cute!
review.name: Cute baby fox

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this suit as a gift for my newborn nephew after getting a similar one from Patagonia for double the price and was surprised to see the Columbia one is actually better quality - it's thicker and better constructed. My nephew looks soo cute dressed as a fox! Absolutely recommend it!
review.name: Super warm and cozy

name: Foxy Baby Sherpa Bunting - Infants'

hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Skwama Vegan Climbing Shoe - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
worn these for a couple weeks in the gym and once outside so far. 
the initial fit was great - I got the same size as my regular Skwamas, and out of the box fit great.  although I'm still hoping for them to break in some more in the toe box.  I understand the synthetic won't stretch as much as its leather counterpart, and have had my toes feel bruised by the end of a gym session.  still a good pair of shoes to have around while my other skwamas are resoled.
review.name: fits like a Skwama waiting to break in

review.reviewBody: Climbed twice in the gym so far in these. Great for little tiny chips and overhang stuff. Bit painful at my regular shoe size, but that's just part of the break in process. I was really stoked to find such a solid vegan option
review.name: so far so good

name: Skwama Vegan Climbing Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Super comfy, stylish and great in the water…dunno what else anyone would want.
review.name: Cool!

review.reviewBody:
I typically wear between a 10 and 10.5 sized show (US). I ordered an 11, hoping it would be large enough for the NRS dry pants socks plus a warm insulating sock. It's a pretty tight fit and while I can wear them, I can't put much layering on and my feet were cold and my toes hit the end of the shoe, which at times was a bit painful (especially if my feet were cold). River bottom traction is OK but not as good as I expected (although probably good by comparison to other shoes).

If I could re-purchase, I would go with a 12 (since they don't do half sizes).
review.name: OK - But would get a larger size

review.reviewBody: Wore them for a majority of the water rescue work I did when deployed to Florida and North Carolina with my USAR team. They were comfortable and grip was fantastic. Did not have any issues, easy to get on and off. Would recommend.
review.name: Solid shoe

review.reviewBody: The sizing was quite a bit smaller than my other astrals but I feel like sizing up would be too big
review.name: Small sizing

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, warm shoe with excellent grip. Perfect for my canoe trips. The high shaft ensures a firm fit and cushions the ankle.
review.name: Comfortable water shoe

review.reviewBody: Great comfortable, grippy shoe, fits perfectly.  I have 2 pairs, one a size up for drysuit booties.  Definitely go a size up for layers!
review.name: Size up for drysuit booties.  Great fit!

review.reviewBody: Have used them twice. Once a river trip and once doing a survey job in a river. Great gripping, good support and high ankle protection. A comfortable shoe that can be worn all day.
review.name: Lovin'  my Astral Hiyak's!

review.reviewBody: The Hiyak's are my go to sailing shoes in breeze over 15knots. The ankle support is second to none, superior grip, light weight and dry out quickly. Theres not much not to like about these shoes!
review.name: Superior Grip!

review.reviewBody: Bought the shoe specifically to fit over a dry suit.  Spend 8 or so days on the Tat/Alsek river wearing the shoe most of the day.  My one criticism is with the sole - I think it should be made more substantial as it seems very thin and made walking over rocks difficult.  I think something like the sole in the water tennie  I have would be better.
review.name: Hiyak brief review

review.reviewBody:
Out of the box, it seems a few design upgrades have been made!  The velcro fits my ankle more precisely than previous models. The triple stitching is still tye way to go! And I swear the rubber is a bit stickier! 

This is at least the fourth time I’ve bought this shoe. The addition of women’s sizing was a necessary no-brainer!

I teach rowing on whitewater and am a swiftwater rescue instructor. This shoe is THE shoe my feet prefer. And when it’s time to go kayaking, it does that too.
review.name: Dope shoes

name: Hiyak Kayak Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: Once in the dirt these tires come alive. Better traction than I expected from a mostly slick tire. Good corner grip, great stability and float. Perfect for our dry dusty gravel roads. Not quite as fast on tarmac.
review.name: Fat tire gravel bike

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
Given tire profile was hoping this would roll faster on pavement as well as some of my local trails. The results were a bit mixed. It is slightly above mid grade on pavement for a "fast" gravel tire ...but definitely slower than some of the others like the All-around. 

On trails the "dry" is definitely an emphasis. It is quickly overwhelmed by big rocks or loose gravel. The only place it really felt at home were hard packed dirt and fire roads. 

Overall its average with average puncture protection. Would not purchase again.
review.name: High hopes, average results

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
I've found these tires to be about as perfect a gravel tire as anything else out there.  Bought them in a 38c, which were 40mm wide mounted on a rim with a 25mm internal width.  Mounting was smooth and easy.  

Next, let's talk about grip.  The hexagonal file tread through the center of the tire does a nice job of braking on gravel surfaces, while keeping the rolling resistance low, even on pavement.  After four months, the center tread started to wear off on the REAR tire.  However, that is no different than any other REAR tire with tread, as the rear is used for both braking and accelerating under power.  The center tread on the front tire is still going strong.  This is a good thing, because control comes from the front tire while steering and braking, while the loss of tread on the back tire yields even lower rolling resistance.  Pertaining to both front and rear, the knobs on the edge do keep an edge while leaning into corners.  And they've held up remarkably well after six months of use.

Lastly, I'll mention puncture protection.  I've done most of my riding these past six months in northwest Arkansas, where the gravel can be sharp and pointy.  And I've raced these tires at both Unbound 100 and Lil' Sugar gravel races.  I've not flatted once.
review.name: Does What It's Supposed To

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: Note:  Embossed on the side of the Terreno Dry 2.0 tire, it states very clearly, "MOUNT ON HOOKED RIM ONLY".  If you have hookless rims, you ride at your own risk.  This information is not printed anywhere else on the packaging or instructions.
review.name: Still Hooked Rims Only

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: Overall, I am a fan of this tire especially when it is on the sale. However, I have only had these tires for less than 2 months and already the back tire is completely worn, but I never had any punctures with this tire which is a plus. I ride 75% pavement and 25% gravel and it performs great on both surfaces. I especially like this tire for wet conditions (ironic given the name) will order these tires again given the sale price.
review.name: Great tire performance but wears quickly

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: They roll smooth on the road with plenty of grip for dirt trails. The cool thing is they have these reverse flaps that help with wet conditions, and they give you some stopping power on gravel by rolling the reverse way to create tread like bumps when it's normally flat in the center. I usually buy them when they're on sale because I know I'll want them as the next pair >'
review.name: I love these tires

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, the only way to discover that these tires are safe for hooked rims only (i.e. you shouldn't use them on hookless wheels) is to read it off the side of the tire. Vittoria makes no mention of this on their site in the product description.
review.name: Install on hooked rims only
comment: I've ridden mine (38c) on hookless rims (Enve G23) over a variety of mountainous gravel terrain in and around Steamboat Springs, CO and they've been fine. No blow-offs or other concerns. Excellent, grippy,. fast and enjoyable tires.

name: Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire
Terreno Dry G2.0 TNT Tubeless Tire

review.itemreviewed: Ducan High GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Mammut's hiking boots are so reliable and value for money. It took me about 2 short hikes to break into the shoes, and now it fits my feet perfectly. The waterproofing works pretty decent, and the grip of the boots are good enough for my usage. I love love love the colourway as well! 
For reference, I am a usual EU38 for shoes and I got this pair of boots in EU38 2/3 (sized up for some allowance since it's a hiking boot) and it fits perfect!
review.name: Comfortable Hiking Boots

review.itemreviewed: Ducan High GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Easy to break in. The waterproofing holds up great.  I have had these out on trails from below zero to about 50¬∞. They are way too warm for 50¬∞. But they did keep my feet pretty warm in the cold temps. They were big enough that I could wear two pairs of socks, a wool liner and a hiking wool sock. The laces lock in and don't come undone halfway through the hike...and after wearing through some pretty muddy trails they clean up really well.  It took about two wearings to break them in but now I can wear them all day with total comfort. I have a high instep with a narrow heel and a wide toebox, and these were incredibly comfortable with just a tad too much space in the heel . Which means that these will fit normal heels just fine.
review.name: Great hiking boot and very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Ducan High GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: While choosing shoes are a highly personal choice, this one fit her perfectly. They are very well made, light and have a good and supportive insole. A good covering with MOTOREX Protex spray will waterproof them perfectly.
review.name: She loves them

review.itemreviewed: Ducan High GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not quite true to size, but pretty close. Great traction and durability, but a bit hard to tighten due to the lack of tongue on the boot. Still very happy with them.
review.name: Pretty great boots!

name: Ducan High GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
