description: Buy the Castelli Undersaddle XL Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Undersaddle XL Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Undersaddle XL Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this undersaddle bag about a month ago and it has worked well for my needs. It holds all I need for tire repair and tube replacement. It is quite compact and I really don't know why they called it an XL bag.
review.name: Quite functional

review.reviewBody: As other reviews have mentioned, it is not really "XL" when compared to other bags on the market. However, as long as you purchase it knowing that, it's a great bag. I fit a tube, Co2, two levers, a multi-tool and a tiny patch kit in there with no room left to spare. The external pocket for a pump was a pleasant surprise (somehow I missed it in the marketing) and should fit most pumps you may otherwise throw in your jersey.
review.name: Sleek, just-big-enough bag

review.reviewBody: Was skeptical about the size of this bag from the images but after receiving and putting all my necessities in and still having a little space while it maintaining its small sleek shape; I've fallen absolutely in love with it. Holds 2 tubes; 3 co2 canisters; levers; multi-tool; patch kit; cards & cash and has room for more. Favorite saddle bag I've owned.
review.name: Awesome Saddle Bag

review.reviewBody:
A lot of folks apparently feel like "XL" is a misnomer, but I gotta say, I wouldn't want a bigger under seat bag than this. I like it so much that I have two -- one for my tubeless Open, and another for my tube tire bikes. 

For me, the thing that sealed the deal is the mini-pump sleeve. I love not having to carry my pump in my jersey or on the frame. Aesthetically, it's better looking than anything else I've seen. 

Functionally, here is what I carry in the one on my tubeless bike:
Lezyne compact (11 tool) multitool 
CO2 valve & cartridge
Tubeless plug kit
2oz bottle of Stan's sealant
2 kool stop tire levers
2 Nitrile gloves
28-622 inner tube
Lezyne high-volume mini pump (in exterior sleeve)

The one for my tube setups has extra room, because it has all of the above minus the Stan's and the plug kit.
review.name: Best under seat bag I've used

name: Undersaddle XL Bag

review.reviewBody: Took these bibs on a week long bike tour and they were great across the board. The chamois is not bulky but was plenty cushy for 50-60+ mi rides. Was able to sink wash and they dried super quick. And they are super flattering! I had never worn bibs but one lady commented “you look so chic”…not exactly what you normally think of wearing cycling shorts! They also fit TTS in non-vanity sizing and fall in line with other brands’ cycle short sizing.
review.name: Five stars all around

review.itemreviewed: Furry Friends Fleece Hooded Jacket - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody:
We got this for our baby to fight with the cold weather.   He loves it
Not only it keeps him warm but it also looks so cute on him.
review.name: Our son loves it !!!

review.itemreviewed: Furry Friends Fleece Hooded Jacket - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: We have 2 of these in different colors and gifted one. The kids always want to wear the jacket and hood up. I get so many complements when my sons are wearing from random people.  They kids tell me it’s so cozy. Just buy it and you won’t regret it.  They wear them playing all day at school, biking, scooter etc. sized up to last two seasons. Just rolled up the sleeves
review.name: The cutest

review.itemreviewed: Furry Friends Fleece Hooded Jacket - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: My 5 year old saw this bear hoodie as I was scrolling the website and he instantly wanted it. He isn’t really that into clothes so I was surprised by his opinion. I ordered it for him and the joy he experienced when it arrived was over the top. He wears it every day now and gets compliments on it wherever we go. His biggest complaint is that it’s not waterproof so it gets wet when it rains. That means he has to begrudgingly wear a rain jacket instead. So far the quality is good and what you’d expect from Patagonia. He can use the zipper on his own which makes mom happy. He is solidly in a 5T and has a longer torso and this hoodie fits well. We will all be sad when he grows out of it!
review.name: 5 year old LOVES it

review.itemreviewed: Furry Friends Fleece Hooded Jacket - Toddlers'
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my 2 year old and she loves it. She specifically asks for this one because it is so cozy.
review.name: Love this cozy Coat

name: Furry Friends Fleece Hooded Jacket - Toddlers'

review.reviewBody: These are my go to leggings for running and hiking. I love the abrasion resistant fabric in all the places that need reinforcement. I also like that the side pocket is tight and keeps my phone in place. My phone has fallen out of pockets of other leggings in the past. These are high waist on me, but i'm only 5'2". Overall these are very comfortable and I wear them for everything.
review.name: Great for Hiking, Running and more

review.reviewBody: I was hoping these would be more versatile. Definitely a winter tight. And shows any lumps and bumps - not something I care to highlight. Had to send them back.
review.name: Visible lumps and warm fabric

review.reviewBody:
I think these run true to size, I ordered a large (155lbs, 30” waist, 41” hips) and they fit well enough. The seam on the reinforced knee fabric feels like it cuts in a little bit and feels a little restricting. It’s kinda of unflattering if you aren’t zero percent body fat. The side pockets are so slim that I can barely fit my iPhone in them (why are pockets still a struggle for women???). And the waistband feels like it slides down on my backside a lot, even with the strings tied. 

I’m a little skeptical that they’ll stay up on a run without me fidgeting the entire time. I got them on sale and am debating on whether to return them.
review.name: Almost there…

review.reviewBody: I bought these as I like my tights with similar features from other brands but have been disappointed in how the others hold up.  I have to say I like the quality of these backcountry leggings.  The fabric, though too shiny and slick, is tough enough.  The reinforced knees and derrière are good. The pockets work.  These are really good quality and good price.  They fit well and look great
review.name: Great leggings

name: Wasatch Adventure Legging - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these expecting the usual great Vans comfort and styling. Sadly, these were so uncomfortable that I stopped wearing them after 2 weeks. The sizing is small and width narrow compared to normal Vans lines. I have had other MTE shoes and not had this problem.
review.name: Poor fit compared to other Vans

review.reviewBody: True to size, I have a wide foot and can’t wear the traditional van,s any more but these make a great compromise fitting my fat feet well & make me an inch taller . Got a good price on black Friday sales Thank you 🙏🏽 If I had any Con,s  ; be that they come with one pair of crap 8mm laces .
review.name: Vans MTE size 10

review.reviewBody: Great shoes, very comfy. I’m on my feet for 12hr shifts and these shoes are great. Terrible grip on smooth wet surfaces but they aren’t meant for that.
review.name: Vans in front again.

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoes less than two months ago and they already started to brake in the front part. The sewing is very weak and poor quality.
review.name: Not a good quality shoe

review.reviewBody:
Great fit, super comfy, look great!
Buying second pair asap
review.name: The Best!

review.reviewBody: Very nice, keeps feet dry and warm in a cold climate, could be a tad wider
review.name: Ultrarange mte

review.reviewBody: I have to see what’s inside things or it’s gone forever. Best packing cube out there, great structure and stackable.
review.name: ADHD-friendly packing

review.reviewBody: Very well made. Perfect for isolating specific clothing or toiletries in your pack while still managing valuable space. Collapsible sides and mesh vented top allow compression and airflow. IMHO, a must-have (at least one!) for overnight or trekking packs, or for use as your toiletry bag in your suitcase!
review.name: Great packing organizer

review.reviewBody: grateful organizing my small stuff and I can see inside the top and I can overstock because the mesh is a little stretchy. I love it.
review.name: we could all use one of these

review.reviewBody: Quality, Sturdy and very usable. The pods hold their shape and fit together nicely into the larger bin. We used four of the Pod 5 and two Pod 10 for our Gregory bin. The see through mess is sturdy and the pods stack easily. The sturdy handles make grab and go of items easy as well. So glad we got these to organize our camping gear.
review.name: Outstanding Quality

review.reviewBody: This pairs great with the Gear Box and keeps little things organized inside of it.
review.name: Great little organizer

name: Alpaca Gear Pod 5L

hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Capilene Air Bottom - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: They are VERY thin.  The material is sheer, very very see through.  For a baselayer, these are not very warm either.
review.name: Very thin, very see through, not warm

review.reviewBody:
Day two of wearing these lovely base leggings and a seem has split open. Absolutely love how light, airy, and warm they are, but it's a deal-breaker if they can't hold up to some slope rides. I got a medium which was actually a little large on me, but that made it all the more comfy-point is the material wasn't stressed. 

It's a lot of money to spend on something that is not durable. Hoping my pair was just defective in stitching.
review.name: Great but not durable

review.reviewBody: Really happy with these pants and the matching top. Super lightweight, comfortable, stretchy, warm. I put this under shell pants in 15-30 degree temps and stayed warm enough out snow shoeing. It seems delicate, like it would snag easily, but so far so issues at all! This is meant to be long underwear and is more sheer so you would not want to wear these as workout pants in public. Seems like they could be great PJ's too though if you needed to sleep in them in a tent or cabin!
review.name: Perfect for hiking and snowshoeing!

review.reviewBody: I ordered these as a hopeful base layer for my ski trip next week. I was hoping the brand and price tag would be promising, but these are very see-through! I'm returning these.
review.name: Sad to see it go

review.reviewBody: These were my first trail shoes - I'm more a road bike guy. Overall, the shoe is stiff and snug but even so I've never blistered or chaffed when walking or riding. Not having a point of reference for grip I'll simply add that along with my OneUp Composite pedals if this is how it is supposed to to feel them I'm a confident trail rider - no slips, etc.
review.name: Snug but comfy

review.reviewBody: Coming from Five Ten Freerider Pros these are the well made shoes and comfy, well made good protection. Downsides are soles not grippiest and they run hot in warm weather (over 75f). Should be good in colder climates. Lack of grip is not great in wet conditions.
review.name: Good but not Freerider Pros

review.reviewBody: Good jacket, great rain pants. My son had them out on a rainy afternoon hike in the woods. Had some good steady rain and we were out for a couple hours. He remained dry throughout his adventures. Jacket hood is well designed, stayed in place and moved well with him so he maintained a good field of view. He did have a complaint that there were no pockets to place his collection of twigs, autumnal leaves, and snail shells. So, 4 out of 5 stars for the jacket pockets would be great. 5 out of 5 for the pants.
review.name: Vesi Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: We don't get much rain so the jacket lives in my child's backpack. Our climate is quite hot so most rain jackets eventually delaminate. But this one is constructed differently so I am hopeful that if rain comes the rain jacket will work when needed.
review.name: Great rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: The rain jacket and rain hat I bought were both very practical and were made very well! Spent more than I usually do, but the jacket has lots of room for growth. The hats seem a little small, so size up for room to grow.
review.name: Awesome quality

review.reviewBody:
Great set! We bought 3 sets and they were great for hiking and fishing. Great for layering and kept the kids dry when we encountered some rain. 
Will purchase as the kids grow
review.name: Great set! We bought 3

review.reviewBody: I love the quality of these raincoats! They keep my girls dry on rainy days!

review.reviewBody: High quality, love the pattern, definitely will need to grow into. We got the 18-24 month for our 18 month old and have to cuff the sleeves a good amount. The description does mention room to grow :)

review.reviewBody: Well built but not for big guys. At max pressure It bobbed while i was pedaling, I am 6'5" 250lbs. So if your over that i do not recommend it. I gave it 4 stars because i am sure it would work well for lighter riders. Guessing 200 and under would work well but not sure above that.
review.name: Well built but not for big guys

review.reviewBody: I was searching for a dropper post for a while and saw this with air suspension. I bought it and installed it with the PNW loam lever on my Giant Talon 2 and its been amazing so far. It is not meant to make it feel like a full suspension bike but its meant to smooth out the rough bumps and big rocks that you come across. I highly recommend this for anyone who's in need of a dropper post.
review.name: Upgrade that any hardtail needs

review.reviewBody: threw it on a SC Stigmata with 650 wheels and it's just an all around good time bike now. where i notice the suspension the most is on rough climbs. the gentle suppression allows for you to maintain the pedaling power versus being bounced around from big rock to big rock. also super pleasant on the pelotas when you find a random pothole.
review.name: 100% diggin it

name: Coast Suspension Dropper IR Seatpost

description: Buy the Klymit Static V Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Static V Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Static V Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Awesome sleeping pad as long as you aren’t too worried about insulation.  I bring this with me whenever I travel internationally (in carry on) and it comes in handy a ton.  I’ve slept in multiple airports on it while everyone else was on the floor or trying to get comfortable on the benches.  I’ve slept on it on bamboo mats in Japanese hostels to add some comfort. I’ve slept in a random spot in the alps when I didn’t get to the refuge I was planning for the night. A night under an overpass on the Kumano Kodo pilgrimage and I’ve done about 45 nights of car camping with it.  Never had any leaks or holes, although I’m careful to almost always have a tarp or tent footprint underneath. The valve is awesome.  It’s the most comfortable sleeping pad I’ve ever slept on and the smallest.  The only thing I would change is I’d like one that’s 3/4 length to make it even more packable.
review.name: Won’t travel without it

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] All good. 
Service has been great. 
Did not expect a completely new pad. 
Will get to test it out next weekend. 
Thanks
review.name: All good. Service has been

review.reviewBody: This is a pretty comfortable sleeping pad for a side sleeper such as myself, however it is only good during the summer months. I went on a late summer backpacking trip and it snowed and the temps dropped significantly during the night time. This pad lost its air during the night due to the cold, and didn't stop any of the cold air form coming through to my body. I run cold at night, and it did not feel super great! I would likely bring this pad again in the warm months if the weather isn't destined to drop significantly. Some benefits is that it is quick to inflate/deflate and its pretty lightweight.
review.name: Warm season only
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: In my honest opinion, this pad is okay. It gets the job done. Once you inflate it, good luck trying to pack it back up into the carrying case. It is impossible to get all of the air out. It does deflate throughout the use. If you roll slight either way, it is not comfortable. Regardless, it beats sleeping on the bare floor.
review.name: Klymit - Static V Recon Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: The reviews were right - this pad is remarkably comfortable despite its minimal footprint.  Slept well.
review.name: Minimal, yet comfortable

review.reviewBody: I had purchased this for a hike on the West Highland Way in Scotland but British Airways lost two of my bags.  This was in one.  I had to buy all new gear.  However, that being said I've used it locally a few times and as the "standard" of camping pads it didn't let me down.  Light, easy to use and deflate.  Recommend.
review.name: Wish I got to use it!

review.reviewBody: Great size and quality! Packs down small. Air valve is also designed perfect and takes ~20 seconds to blow up by mouth.
Great product. Good price. Provided right ant of comfort.
review.name: Great product. Good price. Provided

review.reviewBody: This is a durable, quality, affordable sleeping pad. It lasted me 8 years through many backpacking and car camping trips until it developed a slow leak. Luckily, it has a limited lifetime warranty, and after filing a claim online, they sent me a new pad. Worth the buy! If you tend to sleep cold, you should buy an insulated version instead.
review.name: Durable and affordable

review.reviewBody: Went camping a day ago with a brand new Static V pad. When inflating the pad, the valve broke and couldn‚Äôt be inflated. Slept on the hard ground. I had to cut short the camping trip which I planned for weeks. Extremely disappointed! You get what you pay for‚Ä¶
review.name: Bad valve

hasVariant.name: FreeLite 1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR FreeLite 1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: So far so good - will be looking toward durability in the next year or so.
review.name: So far so good -

review.reviewBody: It’s small, but I was expecting that. I wanted light, and that’s what I got. Intuitive set up. I’ve only used it 5 nights in the Wyoming Range. No rain during that trip at all, so if it leaks I wouldn’t know. Winds were light and variable, so it wasn’t a test of ruggedness. Seems well made, and it’s gonna be my go to for backcountry hunting. I like the straight zips, no guiding zippers around curves. I had to buy 4 extra UL stakes to properly guy out the fly. I’m 5’5”, and this tent would probably be a bit small for any man over 6’2” tall. Also, I can’t imagine not using a footprint under an UL tent. This kinda gear is not cheap, and if you want it to last, cough up the dough for the footprint. With the fp, and the stakes I added, it still weighs in at about 2lbs, 8oz.
review.name: Freelite1p

review.reviewBody: Excellent tent. Very light weight, easy to set up, and holds up well in the rain.
review.name: Excellent tent. Very light weight,

review.reviewBody: I just took the tent out this weekend for a backpacking trip in the white mountains. It was raining all weekend but not a drop of water got in the tent, completely waterproof. The tent is super light and east to set up quick. The inside space was definitely adequate, I'm 6' and 200 lbs. My long, 25" wide sea to summit inflatable air mattress fit well with a bit of extra room and it has several pockets for my phone, headlamp, lighting and things like that. I upgraded from the elixer-1 (which is also a great tent, never leaks) that I've been using for the past 4 years for weight purposes. I'm really happy with the tent.
review.name: Happy I bought it

review.reviewBody: Great tent, light and strong! The one who bring you to the end of the world with joy!
review.name: Freedom!

review.reviewBody: This is the first tent I took backpacking and it worked great. Very light weight in my pack. I was a little intimidated by the set up but after doing it at home it was a breeze at camp. Kept me very warm on a breezy below 40 night. Recommend for a solo hiker like me!
review.name: Great lightweight option for solos!

review.reviewBody:
Excellent tent. Never forked out so much for such a lightweight.
So, knowing claims made by others about their tents I set it up just before it poured inches of rain the next few days.

And the inside stayed home dry.

We risk our lives on so called brand names that no longer deliver.
Been caught out a couple of times before.
MSR you delivered.

I now feel safer hiking in sub zero conditions at high altitudes, knowing I've got this lightweight gem in my kit.
review.name: Waterproof... Excellent

review.reviewBody:
I just bought this today, but as there were no other reviews at the time I thought it was worth posting my first impressions after setting it up in my yard. I hope to update this review in a few months. This review is for the 2022 revision, 1 person tent.

Any tent seems to be a trade off in weight, durability, size and price. If you’re buying this tent weight should be important to you, otherwise get something more durable and bigger. But if you’re planning on backpacking with this read on. The tent as shipped (excluding only the exterior tag on the bag) is 31.9oz. I’m 5’11” and there’s plenty of head room for me to sit-up and lie down inside. Given the rectangular shape of the tent there is likely enough room for me to put a medium size pack near my feet. There are a couple of stash pockets on the interior which are also nice. The dark green color seems great from my perspective (may help keep the tent a little darker at night, and blend into the woods well).

A few minor things that I wish were different:
* I’d rather MSR include the mini ground hog stakes, instead of their needle stakes. The weight change would only be about 1 gram per stake, but I think the ground hogs will hold better
* I wish MSR would include an emergency tent pole repair/patch sleeve with the tent. I've no idea how likely this is to be needed, however it'd add piece of mind, would cost them next to nothing, and some of their competitors that use the same poles include it
* I wish the top of the tent (i.e. where your head is when you’re sitting up) is a little wider. When the mesh door is closed it’s bordering on making me feel claustrophobic
* It’s weird MSR doesn’t include one of their baked-into-the-tent guy lines on the side of the tent opposite to where the door is. You’d always want this part staked out, both to keep the fabric taut and as an extra undercover area where you can stash your gear
* I don’t believe there is an option to pitch this tent fly first. If it’s raining when you set it up you’ll end up with some water in your tent

Overall I’m happy with this tent so far, and picked it instead of its competition (after way too much research) because of it’s relatively light weight and roomy footprint.
review.name: So far so good!

name: FreeLite 1 Tent: 1-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: These (28mm) have been near impossible to properly seat the bead on my rims, even after the usual tricks. Also punctured in the first 75 miles - could have been a fluke but worth noting. Again impossible to properly seat on the rim after the puncture. The ride-feel was fine, but can't trust them unfortunately and will be switching back to conti's. Disappointing purchase for "nicer" tires.
review.name: Can't get them seated on the rim

review.reviewBody: Could be bad luck. Who really knows but I’m bummed. Mounted easily.
review.name: One ride one puncture

review.reviewBody: so far,  my favorite,  over 1000miles without issues on my Zipp 303's,  after trying other brands (vittoria, specialized and contiis) this is the best,  paired it with Silca sealant (no good using muc off),  highly recommended
review.name: excellent tire

review.reviewBody: I started using tubeless tires for gravel about a year ago, and more recently have transitioned to tubeless on my road bikes as well. Trying several brands models. So far (first 200 miles) I really like this Schwalbe Pro One in 28mm. I have them mounted to HED Jet4 Black Plus wheels. On that wheel, the 28s seem slightly narrower than 25mm Continental 4000s tube tires did on the same wheels. The tires weighed in as light on my scale, and feel light and supple on the bike. Weird thing is I could never get an audible "POP" sound when seating, and I was concerned initially, but they hold air pretty well on my setup, losing maybe 15 psi over 48 hours (I always air up my tires before a ride anyway). Full 5 stars and I'll adjust as needed once I rack up more miles.
review.name: So far so good...

review.reviewBody: Real tight getting into enve 45s but they hold air well and ride great so far about 200 miles in. I used the enve psi chart to set em up for my weight.
review.name: Nice on hookless rims

review.reviewBody: Have riddled theses 28mm tires for over 3 years on my VTX ice trike. They have never let me down. Very high quality road tire for paved roads.
review.name: High quality tire

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using these tires on a recumbent trike for about 1000 miles. With proper rim tape, correctly applied, good valves and an air compressor with presta head, they mounted quickly and easily and perform wonderfully. During many rides I have picked up huge sharp thorns not so lovingly referred to as “goat heads” in three of three tires. They either fall out during the ride or pulled out with pliers at home. The sealant cures the holes almost instantly with minimal pressure loss. The rear is 700c and has worn very well. Fronts are 406 and as such obviously wear out much more quickly. I’m on my second set in 3500 miles. Schwalbe advised to run them at 60–65psi which has worked very well. I see no reason to use any other tires.
review.name: Pro one tubeless

name: Pro One Evolution Tire - Tubeless

description: Buy the 45NRTH Wolfgar Cycling Boot - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wolfgar Cycling Boot - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the 45NRTH Wolfgar Cycling Boot - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have a heart condition that affects my circulation, making my fingers and toes very cold on winter night rides, even here on the east coast.  They get cold enough that I have had long term nerve damage in my toes.  I know that these boots are way over rated for the temperatures that I wore them in, but they kept my feet warm and dry and cozy all winter long.  Not once were my feet hot, sweaty or uncomfortable.  I never really noticed any restrictiveness  while riding, although they are big boots.  Given the size and the insulation, these are incredibly comfortable boots.  

These are awesome boots that allowed me to keep leading winter night rides, while waiting for heart surgery.
review.name: Wonderful Warm Boots

review.reviewBody: This is overkill for most conditions. I've had these on at -34C (-29F) with mid-weight merino sock for 90 min and my feet were so hot I was wondering if I should loosen the boots to cool down. I can't imagine what the rest of my outfit should be to accommodate lower temperatures to make these worth their billing. I followed 45NRTH's sizing guide and ended up at 46, usually wearing 44.5-45. That "size up" is enough for a thicker wool sock, but I can't even begin to pretend that I'd ride with my feet this warm. So, my feet are going to be loose in these boots. Works well with SM-SH51 - nothing to report there - crank arm clearance is adequate and the cleat is hidden well enough for hardwood floors. Watch the toe overlap - they're "big". I think I'll use them off the bike more since they're so warm. Maybe a "life-saver" for those with cold feet and/or with poor circulation. Can't speak to how waterproof they are - it's too cold here for any liquid, but light snow, slush and spray off the motor vehicles has been handled gracefully - the only moisture I felt was from my sweat.
review.name: Insane

name: Wolfgar Cycling Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Tahoe Sun Crew - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Tahoe Sun Crew - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tahoe Sun Crew - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Tahoe Sun Crew - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use the black version of this shirt for work (I am 5'6", 135, 34B, longer torso, longer arms). As other reviews mention, the collar rests kind of high on the neck, but I mean I wear it for sun protection outside so that's fine with me. Is it warm to wear a black long sleeve shirt outside on 90F days? Yes lol. But I need the sun protection. Luckily I'm running from AC to outside a lot so it's fine. But if I was outside for prolonged periods of time (more than 30 minutes), I'd be sweaty. It isn't the most lightweight fabric, but it beats wearing sunscreen. The thumb holes are nice. For me, the sleeves are a good length.
review.name: Work Shirt

review.reviewBody: The fabric is really nice and so I wear it. The neck is really off, it feels more like a turtle neck as it rides on my neck. I constantly have to pull it forward as it is always at my neck.
review.name: Fabric is nice, odd fit.

review.reviewBody: Love the print, fabric feels silky and smooth. XL fits well in the arms and chest, but the body is weirdly snug. The arms are also very long, to the point that the thumb holes are past my thumbs. To be fair, I am short with short arms, so this might be a good feature for tall people.
review.name: Nice fabric, sizing is off

review.reviewBody: I ordered 2 in 2022 and loved them, I just wished they had fun colors like the men's Tahoe shirts. I ordered 3 more in 2023 - two colors from 2022 and one new color. The new color doesn't have a pocket, the sleeves are too long, and the medium was tight on my biceps. The two old colors with pockets fit perfectly. I don't know why they changed the design.
review.name: Old Was Better

review.reviewBody: I love soft, breathable long-sleeved tech shirts and have a ton of them from different brands, but our Tahoe Sun Crew is my favorite. It is SO soft, comfortable, and breathable. I swear, I'd wear it every day if I could. I pretty much live in it! I love that it has a pocket on the rear for a key, gel, card or anything as so many shorts these days don't have pockets. It provides great sun protection and looks great. The hoody is amazing and I love it, but for those days you don't want a hood, the crew is perfect! I normally wear a large in tech shirts and wear a large in this one - perfect fit. I love love love this shirt and it is one of my all-time favorite Backcountry products. If you have any questions about our Tahoe line or any of our other products, please don't hesitate to reach out to me at amcclary@backcountry.com or 801-204-4562.
review.name: I live in this shirt!

review.reviewBody: I have this in 2 colors. Very comfortable and fits well.
review.name: Love this shirt

review.reviewBody: The shirt is comfortable, the fabric is soft but it’s too thick for a sun shirt. It’s great for layering or alone if it’s 60-70 degrees. About 80 degrees at 9.5k feet and I was sweating like crazy.
review.name: Thick

review.reviewBody: I got the Medium tropical peach sun shirt and the color is very peachy and looks very different from online. I was thinking it would be more light pink, everyone's screens show color differently so it was a gamble. I also dont love the location of the pocket, if the shirt is not pulled down to your butt it doesn't sit straight, I would be annoyed with it while hiking/biking etc... I am going to check our the Sunhoodie instead because it doesn't have that pocket.
review.name: Tropical Peach

review.reviewBody: I recently wore this on a long hike in Montana to protect me from the sun. The material is not hot, but lightweight and breathable. I love the pocket, which I use for dog treats for my canine hiking buddy. I am petite and many times sleeves are ridiculously long, but these are only just a tad long. I just ordered two more. I'd love a 3/4 length sleeve version.
review.name: Great sun protection!

review.reviewBody:
Love these and how lightweight they are. The pocket on the side is also awesome for keys.
But could we please have the same colors as the men? If there was a mens XS I’d buy those just for the other fun colors.
review.name: Love

name: Tahoe Sun Crew - Women's
